column1: hellyeahomeland 159909510581 "2017-04-23 19:24:19 GMT" http://hellyeahomeland.com/post/159909510581 "I wonder sometimesâ€“not often
column2: but latelyâ€“whether I chose Homeland
column3: or it chose me. Did I just happen upon it
column6: by some magical stroke of fate
column7: draw me to it?Regardless of the answer to that question
column8: there is no question I love this show. Unequivocally
column10: I love it. I like to think that unbridled
column11: unfettered love is what drew some of you to reading
column12: however long ago. There is real truth in passion and love
column13: and I hope that is shown in what Iâ€™ve done here. This show and this place have actually changed my life. They reignited parts of me that had fallen dormant and sparked things inside me that I didnâ€™t know I had the capacity to hold.From that love
column15: now almost four years ago. To describe it as just a â€œblogâ€ seems not enough right now. It wasâ€“and isâ€“so much more than that. Iâ€™ve poured my heart and my soul into this thing. At times
column16: Iâ€™ve poured my own sanity (sorry). Through personal upheaval and major life changes
column17: this space has remained a constant
column19: I wonder what you all thought? I wonder what you had to say about what I thought? I felt reassured
column23: the promise that as much as I loved this show there were others out there who loved it as I did. I didnâ€™t feel that closeness
column24: that unity behind a shared love and passion
column25: until I came here. You may have noticed Iâ€™ve been relatively quiet around here over the last two weeks. That Iâ€™ve mostly retreated
column26: resurfacing to offer words of diplomacy
column27: words of â€œI hopeâ€ and â€œcan we all just agree thatâ€¦â€ That Iâ€™ve sometimes sidestepped discussions of the narrativeâ€™s flaws; of real-life events that may have precipitated that narrative; and of overall commentary (or lack thereof) by the major players in various media in the aftermath of the finale. If you can understand the love that I have for this television series
column28: in many ways that are difficult to articulate
column29: then maybe you understand my need for it not to be what it is now. Which feels like something horrible and broken and false
column30: an ugly lie. For it to be anything else would mean that I have sunk years of my life into something that turned out to be just not worth the time. A broken promise. To even dwell on that makes me sadder than Iâ€™m able to say. It would be a lie still to deny that the negativity and pain and hurt and angerâ€“though deservedâ€“building up around this show
column31: as evident through the words on this blog
column32: donâ€™t make me feel deeply uncomfortable. They follow me like a dark cloud over this thing Iâ€™ve created. I wonder
column33: has this all been for naught? Has this all been a terrible
column34: terrible lie? If you have asked yourself why I havenâ€™t unleashed
column35: why Iâ€™ve tempered your anger and offered meager attempts at empathy
column36: and why Iâ€™ve (until now) held it together
column37: this is the answer. Iâ€™ve felt lately like Iâ€™ve been treading murky waters. But to do otherwise is to give in to that lie. To accept it as the truth. Many of you are already there. You may be stronger and more honest than I am. But Iâ€™m not there
column38: not yet. And Iâ€™ll fight hard to keep my head above water. " True text

column1: hellyeahomeland 159714807727 "2017-04-18 13:00:21 GMT" http://hellyeahomeland.com/post/159714807727 "We wanted to give you a heads up on several things.Asks: Asks are slowing but continue to roll in and we are determined to answer every one to the best of our ability. column7: and a comprehensive list by topics is on our Hiatus List of Things to Tackle.Â Petition: @keepcalmandquarrieonâ€˜s petition is still live and has hundreds of signatures. Itâ€™sÂ here. Have your voice heard: you can sign anonymously

column12: can it really be that long) years

We intend to keep that dialogue going.Â We will continue to post any Showtime news. Keep in mind we didnâ€™t get anything from Gansa until about a month after the season five finale.Â We will keep a close a eye on how Quinnâ€™s legacyâ€“for both Carrie and the narrative at largeâ€“is depicted in season seven. We all feel this is extremely important.Â We plan to continue celebrating Quinn and will also be keeping tabs on Rupertâ€™s career goings-on as we make a larger shift to covering the entire castâ€™s career moves beyond this show throughout the hiatus and beyond.Â As always

column1: hellyeahomeland 159415331851 "2017-04-10 14:37:52 GMT" http://hellyeahomeland.com/post/159415331851 "Last night
column2: Peter Quinn died.Â For some of you
column3: maybe he died over a season ago. Maybe he died in that gas chamber
column6: â€ as we came to identify him
column7: was but a distant memory.Â Quinn 2.0
column8: the Peter Quinn we saw this season
column9: was in some respects worlds apart from that man. I will not rattle off the list because we know it well. We saw him struggle
column11: we saw both his slowly boiling rage at his slow recovery as well as his eventual resignation that this might be the end for him.Â This is what matters
column13: in life and in death. He loved fully
column14: with his whole heart and without abandon. He was totally and completely committed to his country and to those he loved. He kept a tattered copy of Great Expectations in his dresser
column15: seemingly took it with him everywhere he went. It was filled with photos of Julia
column16: the mother of his child; John
column17: the son he never knew; and Carrie
column18: the woman whom he loved as no other.Thatâ€™s tragedy.Â To call it anything else would be a lie.Â I wasnâ€™t expecting to have to write this. I spoke confidently that he would be fine. That the forces that kept him alive last year (and the year before
column19: and the year before that) would keep him alive this year. I was wrong. So now we grieve.Â I think that everyone will process this death in different ways. Already I have seen reactions of anger
column21: and abject sadness. In the coming days and weeks we will be open to all these reactions
column22: because thatâ€™s what a community is for.Â In the meantime
column23: if you need to take a break
column24: thatâ€™s ok. If you need to say goodbye
column26: too. If and when you decide to come back
column27: HYH will be here.Â " True text
